title: Md. taking tentative steps toward clean construction rules: 'How we buy things matters' - Maryland Matters
summary: Brad Hill, a former civil contractor, has invented a new method for producing concrete that is less carbon-intensive than traditional methods. Hill's method, called the Hill Process, uses a cold-temperature chain reaction to reproduce the chemical reaction that occurs when volcanic ash is exposed to water. The resulting concrete is half as heavy as standard concrete and has a greater life cycle. Four states have passed Buy Clean laws of their own, and a dozen states, including Maryland, have signed on to the Federal-State Buy Clean Partnership, a proposed procurement policy.
